page.title: 11Housing and Settlement
page.content: Recent settlement in the village is reflected for example in the Primary School Roll since 1975 when the full effect of oil development began. In two year phases, from 184 pupils in 1975, numbers move through 260, 265, 260, 255, to 230 in 1985. At the same time housing has been provided with 132 high value houses built. Residents in these are mainly professional executive oil-related personnel. The rapid inflow of newcomers is slowing down. Early 20th Century housing is Granite roofed with slate. Council housing has been Harled cement block roofed with tile or shingle with the latest being 40 imported prefabricated timber. Owner-occupier development has been mainly of timber-frame with a variety of decorative cladding and tile roofs.
